greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between larger and smaller terms of n-th amicable pair.
comment: Values are sorted along increasing A002025. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 19 2009, Jul 23 2009
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..415523
example: a(7) = 2310 because the 7th pair of amicable numbers is 12285 and 14595; and 14595 - 12285 = 2310.
mathematica: With[{s = PositionIndex@Array[DivisorSigma[1, #] &, 10^6]}, Flatten@ Map[Differences, Apply[Join, Map[Function[n, Select[Subsets[Lookup[s, n], {2}], Total@ # == n &]], Sort@ Select[Keys@ s, Length@ Lookup[s, #] > 1 &]]]]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 22 2017 *)
results.author: Robert A. Stump (bee_ess107(AT)yahoo.com), Jan 06 2002
ext: Sorted on smaller term for alignment with A002046 and A002025. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 19 2009
A-number in comment corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 23 2009
